metadata.dc:author: Cabeza Martínez, B
Ferreirós Domínguez, J
Bustos García de Castro, A
Arévalo Galeano, N
metadata.dc:description: We present the case of an asymptomatic patient with an initial clinical and radiological diagnosis of lung metastases in whom histological study diagnosed anthracosilicosis. A review of the literature shows that this presentation of anthracosilicosis is exceptional; our patient had atypical radiological findings and a very long latency period (over 50 years) after a brief (nearly 6 years) exposure to coal dust.
metadata.dc:title: Silicoantracosis: una forma de presentación clinicorradiológica excepcional simulando metástasis pulmonares.
[Anthracosilicosis: a rare clinical and radiological presentation simulating lung metastases].
